text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness hasn’t overcome° it.

footnotes.text: The word translated “overcome” ([greek]κατέλαβεν[/greek]) can also be translated “comprehended.” It refers to getting a grip on an enemy to defeat him.

text: The Word became flesh and lived among us. We saw his glory, such glory as of the only born° Son of the Father, full of grace and truth.

footnotes.text: The phrase “only born” is from the Greek word “[greek]μονογενους[/greek]”, which is sometimes translated “only begotten” or “one and only”.

text: For the law was given through Moses. Grace and truth were realized through Jesus Christ.°
No one has seen God at any time. The only born° Son,° who is in the bosom of the Father, has declared him.

footnotes.text: The phrase “only born” is from the Greek word “[greek]μονογενη[/greek]”, which is sometimes translated “only begotten” or “one and only”.

text: They asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the prophet?” He answered, “No.”
He said, “I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’° as Isaiah the prophet said.”
